answers.answer: Hi.While a general practitioner would also be able to recognize and determine that someone has a retinal detachment, if you have a strong suspicion that RD is indeed present, especially if you have researched on the condition, it would be advisable to consult an ophthalmologist to check your symptoms as well as rule out any other ocular disorder.Hope this helps.
I don't know if i have it for sure, but i do want to get it checked out.

Hi.What are your symptoms? Do you experience eye floaters, light flashes, watery vision, a feeling of a curtain blocking your vision, or a sudden dramatic decrease of vision.These symptoms are, indeed suggestive of retinal detachment and you should consult an ophthalmologist immediately.Hope this helps.
